<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Restricted"
>
[Undead Master Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3492) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 41</row>

**Archetype** [Undead Master](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=176)

**Prerequisites**
evil alignment

</column>

---

You gain the services of an [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) companion that travels with you and obeys your commands. The rules for undead companions are under [Undead Companions](/Rules.aspx?ID=1690) and utilize those for [animal companions](/Rules.aspx?ID=149).

 Contrary to the usual rules for companions, as an undead master it's possible for you to have more than one undead companion at a time. However, only one of those companions, your “active companion,” follows you during exploration and encounters; the rest are reduced to an “inactive” state that can be easily tucked into an inventory or stored in a nearby crypt. If you ever have more than one undead companion, you gain the Call Companion action, with your undead companions taking the place of animal companions.

<document level="2" id="action-601" />

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the undead master archetype.

<title level="2">Undead Master Dedication leads to...</title>
[Guardian Ghosts](/Feats.aspx?ID=3493), [Their Master's Call](/Feats.aspx?ID=3494)
name: Undead Master Dedication
